member.name: T:LibreHardwareMonitor.Hardware.Motherboard.Lpc.EC.WindowsEmbeddedControllerIO
member.summary: An unsafe but universal implementation for the ACPI Embedded Controller IO interface for Windows
member.remarks: It is unsafe because of possible race condition between this application and the PC firmware when writing to the EC registers. For a safe approach ACPI/WMI methods have to be used, but those are different for each motherboard model.

member.name: P:LibreHardwareMonitor.Hardware.SystemInformation.Family
member.summary:
Gets the family associated with system.
This text string identifies the family to which a particular computer belongs. A family refers to a set of computers that are similar but not identical from a hardware or software point of view. Typically, a family is composed of different computer models, which have different configurations and pricing points. Computers in the same family often have similar branding and cosmetic features.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_CRITICAL_WARNING.AvailableSpaceLow
member.summary: If set to 1, then the available spare space has fallen below the threshold.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_CRITICAL_WARNING.TemperatureThreshold
member.summary: If set to 1, then a temperature is above an over temperature threshold or below an under temperature threshold.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_CRITICAL_WARNING.ReliabilityDegraded
member.summary: If set to 1, then the device reliability has been degraded due to significant media related errors or any internal error that degrades device reliability.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_CRITICAL_WARNING.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set to 1, then the media has been placed in read only mode

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_CRITICAL_WARNING.VolatileMemoryBackupDeviceFailed
member.summary: If set to 1, then the volatile memory backup device has failed. This field is only valid if the controller has a volatile memory backup solution.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.CriticalWarning
member.summary: This field indicates critical warnings for the state of the controller. Each bit corresponds to a critical warning type; multiple bits may be set.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.CompositeTemp
member.summary: Composite Temperature: Contains the temperature of the overall device (controller and NVM included) in units of Kelvin.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.AvailableSpare
member.summary: Available Spare: Contains a normalized percentage (0 to 100%) of the remaining spare capacity available

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.AvailableSpareThreshold
member.summary: Available Spare Threshold: When the Available Spare falls below the threshold indicated in this field, an asynchronous event completion may occur. The value is indicated as a normalized percentage (0 to 100%).

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.PercentageUsed
member.summary: Percentage Used: Contains a vendor specific estimate of the percentage of NVM subsystem life used based on the actual usage and the manufacturers prediction of NVM life. A value of 100 indicates that the estimated endurance of the NVM in the NVM subsystem has been consumed, but may not indicate an NVM subsystem failure. The value is allowed to exceed 100.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.DataUnitRead
F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.DataUnitWritten
F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.HostReadCommands
member.summary: Host Read Commands: Contains the number of read commands completed by the controller. For the NVM command set, this is the number of Compare and Read commands.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.HostWriteCommands
member.summary: Host Write Commands: Contains the number of write commands completed by the controller. For the NVM command set, this is the number of Write commands.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.ControllerBusyTime
member.summary: Controller Busy Time: Contains the amount of time the controller is busy with I/O commands.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.PowerCycles
member.summary: Power Cycles: Contains the number of power cycles.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.PowerOnHours
member.summary: Power On Hours: Contains the number of power-on hours. This does not include time that the controller was powered and in a low power state condition.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.UnsafeShutdowns
member.summary: Unsafe Shutdowns: Contains the number of unsafe shutdowns. This count is incremented when a shutdown notification is not received prior to loss of power.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.MediaAndDataIntegrityErrors
member.summary: Media Errors: Contains the number of occurrences where the controller detected an unrecoverable data integrity error. Errors such as uncorrectable ECC, CRC checksum failure, or LBA tag mismatch are included in this field.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.NumberErrorInformationLogEntries
member.summary: Number of Error Information Log Entries: Contains the number of Error Information log entries over the life of the controller

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.WarningCompositeTemperatureTime
member.summary: Warning Composite Temperature Time: Contains the amount of time in minutes that the controller is operational and the Composite Temperature is greater than or equal to the Warning Composite Temperature Threshold.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.CriticalCompositeTemperatureTime
member.summary: Critical Composite Temperature Time: Contains the amount of time in minutes that the controller is operational and the Composite Temperature is greater than the Critical Composite Temperature Threshold.

member.name: F:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.NVME_HEALTH_INFO_LOG.TemperatureSensor
member.summary: Contains the current temperature reported by temperature sensor 1-8.

member.name: P:LibreHardwareMonitor.Interop.Kernel32.IOControlCode.Code
member.summary: Gets the resulting IO control code.
